intro: Eutoca pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf eutoca, is a small, herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along riverbanks. The plant has small, ovate leaves that are usually less than 2 centimeters in length. Its flowers are tiny, clustered in inflorescences, and often have a white or pale green color. Eutoca pusilla is adapted to thrive in humid climates and is often found in low-light conditions.
